Description: End of a tunic sleeve; ribbed silk and cotton; groups of length ways stripes of various width in blue, green, dark brown, beige, yellow and white; sleeve shape gently tapering with a hemmed end; warp-faced extended tabby. Warp: silk, Z-twist, ca 130 threads/cm. Weft: cotton, ca 32 paired picks/cm. Edge: hidden or fragmentary. Sewing: in red silk S-twist Z-ply thread, hem and run-and-fell seam.
Curator's comments: History of use: not clear whether a child’s or adult’s tunic.
Bibliographic references: Akbarnia et al 2018 / The Islamic World: a History in Objects (p.133, fig.2)
Condition: Poor; worn; silk perished and faded.
Acquisition name: Donated by: Maj William Joseph Myers (executors of)
